results.title: Fight for life
results.brief_description: Until the 20th century the native farmers of the Gold Coast of Africa were ignorant of the plough and the wheel. Today, their primitive farming methods are being improved through expert instruction, and there are centres where they can learn about dipping, vaccinating, feeding, and improving the quality of their cattle. Commentary by Julian Huxley.

results.title: Fields of sacrifice
results.brief_description: A memorable tribute to more than 100,000 Canadians who gave their lives in the service of their country on foreign battlegrounds. The film visits battlefields of the first and second World Wars and cemeteries where servicemen are buried. Filmed from Hong Kong to Sicily, this documentary is designed to show Canadians places they have reason to know but may not be able to visit. The footage shot on location by Eugene Boyko is imaginatively intercut with archival footage. Douglas Rain narrates this award winning film scripted by Donald Brittain. Edited by Rex Tasker. (Awards: Columbus, Victoria, Toronto)

results.title: Field Diary
results.brief_description: This film examines the Israeli occupation of the West Bank. Israeli filmmaker Amos Gitai interviews Israeli soldiers, Palestinians whose homes have been destroyed or taken from them, and new Israeli settlers.

results.title: Fiberglass = Fibreglass
results.creator_credit: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the versatility of fibreglass, showing preparation of a single mould, lamination, removal of the mould and finishing. Also shows the method of repairing an object made of fibreglass.

results.title: FI11 Pilots first flight
results.brief_description: Pilots and navigators trained to fly F111 aircraft, spend weeks mastering the process in a flight simulator and learning about the planes before becoming proficient enough to fly the F111 fighter jets. Trainee pilots become skilled in the performance of the F111 whilst the navigator trainees study the radar and navigation systems of the aircraft. This program documents the training process which results in the pilots and navigators first flight in the F111 jets.

results.title: Fellow Traveller
results.creator_credit: Philip Saville, Michael Wearing, BBC Film Unit, BFI and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: A leading American screenwriter arrives in London in the mid-50’s to make a new life. Back in Hollywood, a famous movie star shoots himself. The link between these involves a girl and a history - that of the McCarthy witch hunts and the careers they destroyed. Asa Kaufman (Ron Silver) finds work writing a Robin Hood serial in the eccentric world of Britain’s new ITV, but he can’t escape the psychic and political pressures that drove him into exile. With Daniel J. Travanti.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Saville, Michael Wearing, BBC Film Unit, BFI and Home Box Office

results.title: Felidae
results.creator_credit: Vanessa White, Sarah Watt and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: This hand-drawn animation tells the story of two people’s sightings of a big-cat or panther in the Dandenongs of Melbourne. The visuals accompanying the voice-overs serve to add to the story in more abstract terms with painted film and iconic images of panthers intermixed with the voices.

results.title: Feelings. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Justin Shortal, Cate Fyffe, CVV Productions and Environment Audio Visuals
results.brief_description: A series of vignettes is presented each of which focuses on one of the following feelings: anger; jealousy; rejection and loneliness. The dramatised situations are usually open-ended thus providing a stimulus for discussion. High school students are used to play the roles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
